Detailed Description

This class provides ink-morphing functionality to morph one word image (src0) to another (src1). Each image has a mesh associated with it. mesh0 is assumed to be rectangular and mesh1 will get warped. Mesh0 is evenly spaced every N pixels and Mesh1 is given initial alignment using Dynamic Programming (DP) mapping of the control points.

compute medial axis of img0. compute distance map of img1.

The "improve morph" algorithm then consists of the following: for each control point find the best new location of any within the perturbation area. The best location is that with lowest morph cost. Morph cost calculated as sum of distance map values at warped position of each medial axis pixel.

Refine mesh algorithm is just to split each existing quad into 4 quads in both meshes without moving any control points. (Just insert a control point at the midpoint of each mesh edge)

Overall process for auto-morph: improve morph a few times, then refine once, then improve morph a few. Repeat until total cost isn't changing much or for a set number of times.

double DMorphInk::getCost ( )

Calculates total cost as the avg distance MedialAxis0 pixels travel (from their original DP-warped positions) plus the avg cost for MA1 pixels in distance map created from warped MA0.

References DImage::create(), DImage::dataPointer_u32(), DImage::dataPointer_u8(), DImage::DImage_u8, DImage::fill(), DDistanceMap::getDistFromInkBitonal_(), h1, imgDist1, lenMA0, lenMA1, numPointCols, rgMA0c, rgMA0r, rgMA0s, rgMA0t, rgMA0X, rgMA0Y, rgMA1X, rgMA1Y, w1, warpPoint(), and warpPointNew().

DImage DMorphInk::getMorphAtTime ( double  dblTime,
bool  fWarpOnly = false,
bool  fDrawMesh = false,
double  pad_val = 128.,
bool  fOverlayImg1 = false,
bool  fShowMedialAxis0 = false,
bool  fShowMedialAxis1 = false,
bool  fNoMorph = false 
)

Used for DEBUG/visualization only.

Returns the morph at some point between 0. and 1. (inclusive). If fWarpOnly is true, there will be no fade/blend, just warping of the pixels from src0 to the mesh of src1. ***This is a simplified function*** It assumes that the mesh at t=0 is rectangular and does not do backward mapping for pixel values and instead does super-sampled forward mapping.

References DImage::convertedImgType(), DImage::create(), D_CHECKPTR, DImage::dataPointer_u8(), DImage::DImage_RGB, DImage::DImage_u8, DImage::drawLine(), DImage::drawPixel(), fFaintMesh, DImage::fill(), DImage::getImageType(), h0, h1, lenMA0, lenMA1, numPointCols, numPointRows, pimg0, pimg1, rgMA0X, rgMA0Y, rgMA1X, rgMA1Y, rgPoints0X, rgPoints0Y, rgPoints1X, rgPoints1Y, DImage::save(), SUBSAMPLE, w0, w1, and warpPointAtTime().

If fWarpOnly is true, there will be no fade/blend, just warping of the pixels from src0 to the mesh of src1. ***This is a simplified function*** It assumes that the mesh at t=0 is rectangular and does not do backward mapping for pixel values and instead does super-sampled forward mapping.

DImage DMorphInk::getMovementHeatmapAtTime ( double  dblTime,
bool  fDrawMesh = false,
bool  fShowMedialAxisDP = false,
bool  fShowMedialAxisTarget = false,
int  scale = 1,
bool  fStartAtDP = false,
bool  fStartAtPreviousEnd = false 
)

linearly interpolated the positions of MA0 starting at DP-warped positions

dblTime should be on the range [0.,1.] The positions of MA0 are linearly interpolated from the DP position to the final morphed position. If fShowMedialAxisDP is true, the original positions will be shown in gray. Dark blue is 0 movement. Red is most movement.

References DImage::convertedImgType(), DImage::create(), D_CHECKPTR, DImage::dataPointer_u8(), DImage::DImage_RGB, DImage::DImage_u8, DImage::drawLine(), fFaintMesh, DImage::fill(), DImage::getImageType(), h0, h1, lenMA0, lenMA1, MAXDISTCOLORS, numPointCols, numPointRows, pimg0, pimg1, rgDPMA0X, rgDPMA0Y, rgMA0X, rgMA0Y, rgMA1X, rgMA1Y, rgPoints0X, rgPoints0Y, rgPoints1X, rgPoints1Y, rgPointsPrevX, rgPointsPrevY, SUBSAMPLE, w0, w1, warpPoint(), and warpPointAtTime().

References DImage::create(), DImage::DImage_RGB, DImage::drawPixel(), DImage::fill(), h0, h1, lenMA0, rgMA0X, rgMA0Y, rgPoints0X, rgPoints0Y, SUBSAMPLE, w0, w1, and warpPointAtTime().

double DMorphInk::getWordMorphCost ( const DImage &  src0,
const DImage &  src1,
int  bandWidthDP = 15,
double  nonDiagonalCostDP = 0.,
int  meshSpacingStatic = -1,
int  numRefinementsStatic = -1,
double  meshDiv = 4.0,
double  lengthMismatchPenalty = 0.0 
)

Returns the "difference" metric between two words.

Use this function to just get the cost of comparing two words to each other. Don't need to call init() or anything because this function will do that. However, it assumes that the images are cropped, size-normalized, deslanted, and baselines aligned, etc. This will do an automorph from 0 to 1 and then from 1 to 0 and add the two costs together to get the final cost. bandWidth is the width of the Dynamic Programming band (Rath and Manmatha used 15 for the George Washington letters. This is the final version of the function used in the dissertation, which uses both a dist map from red and blue in each calculation.

References fOnlyDoCoarseAlignment, fOnlyDoOneDirection, getCost(), DImage::height(), improveMorph(), init(), refineMeshes(), warpCostDP, warpCostDPfull, warpCostDPhoriz, warpCostDPv, and DImage::width().

const DImage &  src1,
int  bandWidthDP = 15,
double  nonDiagonalCostDP = 0.,
int  meshSpacingStatic = -1,
int  numRefinementsStatic = -1,
double  meshDiv = 4.0,
double  lengthMismatchPenalty = 0.0 
)

same as getWordMorphCost except that it forces numImprovesPerRefinement to 1 and numRefinements to 0 for a fast pass at the data.

void DMorphInk::improveMorph ( )

Iterates through each point within a rectangular region around the current control point looking for lowest cost position to place the control point.

References curColSpacing, curRowSpacing, getVertexPositionCost(), getVertexPositionCostNew(), lenMA0, numPointCols, numPointRows, radiusX, radiusY, rgMA0X, rgMA0Y, rgPlacePoints0, rgPoints1X, rgPoints1Y, rgTempMA0idx, rgTempMA0X, rgTempMA0Y, SUBSAMPLE, and tempMA0len.

Referenced by getWordMorphCost(), and getWordMorphCostFast().

void DMorphInk::improveMorphFast ( )

similar to improveMorph except that it doesn't check every position's placement cost. it does coarse-to-fine.

References curColSpacing, curRowSpacing, getVertexPositionCost(), getVertexPositionCostNew(), lenMA0, numPointCols, numPointRows, radiusX, radiusY, rgMA0X, rgMA0Y, rgPlacePoints0, rgPoints1X, rgPoints1Y, rgTempMA0idx, rgTempMA0X, rgTempMA0Y, SUBSAMPLE, and tempMA0len.

void DMorphInk::resetMeshes ( int  columnSpacing,
int  rowSpacing,
int  bandRadius = 15,
double  nonDiagonalDPcost = 0. 
)

reset meshes. uses col/row spacing on mesh0, uses DP to align mesh1

The last column and row may be different size than the rest so we can stay on pixel boundaries in mesh0. If -1 is specified, the initialColSpacing or initialRowSpacing (respectively) will be used

  • this assumes that they have been previously set, of course.

References DImage::create(), curColSpacing, curRowSpacing, D_CHECKPTR, DProfile::dataLen(), DProfile::dataPointer(), DImage::DImage_u8, DImage::drawPixel(), DWordFeatures::extractWordFeatures(), DImage::fill(), DDynamicProgramming::findDPAlignment(), DDynamicProgramming::getCoord0MappingsToCoord1(), DProfile::getImageVerticalProfile(), h0, h1, initialColSpacing, initialRowSpacing, lenMA0, meshLevel, numPointCols, numPointRows, DDynamicProgramming::piecewiseLinearWarpDImage(), pimg0, pimg1, rgDPMA0X, rgDPMA0Y, rgMA0c, rgMA0quadH, rgMA0quadW, rgMA0r, rgMA0s, rgMA0t, rgMA0X, rgMA0Y, rgPlacePoints0, rgPoints0X, rgPoints0Y, rgPoints1X, rgPoints1Y, rgPointsDPX, rgPointsDPY, rgPointsPrevX, rgPointsPrevY, DImage::save(), DFeatureVector::setData_dbl(), w0, w1, warpCostDP, warpCostDPv, and warpPoint().
